bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Pages H3251-H3252]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McKINLEY:H.R. 2272.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following: the bill is[[Page H3252]]authorized by Congress' power to ``provide for the commonDefense and general Welfare of the United States'' pursuantto Article I, section 8 of the United States Constitution.

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2014

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 126.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.
Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

summary.text:
Directs the Secretary of Defense (DOD) to establish an electronic means by which members of the Ready Reserve of the Armed Forces can track their operational active-duty service performed after January 28, 2008.

Requires the tour calculator to specify early retirement credit authorized for each qualifying tour of active duty, as well as cumulative early reserve retirement credit authorized to date.

bill.title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to establish an electronic means by which members of the Ready Reserves of the Armed Forces may track their active-duty service.

item.title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to establish an electronic means by which members of the Ready Reserves of the Armed Forces may track their active-duty service.
To direct the Secretary of Defense to establish an electronic means by which members of the Ready Reserves of the Armed Forces may track their active-duty service.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
